resources.string: You can download upto 3 languages into the application
Step 1: Select any downloaded language from the dropdown below:
You can download new languages by clicking the \'Add Language\' button and remove already downloaded languages by clicking the \'Delete Language\' button
Hello! you are using Jellow Communicator.
Delete a language to add new language
To enable a keyboard of your choice and make it as default, you need to complete 2 steps:
Step 1: Enable Keyboard from device settings
Step 2: Save Keyboard as default option

• Jellow remembers the user\'s \"most-used/preferred\" icons and displays them as the top choices on the screen

  • By resetting preferences, the icons will be set to the original order in which they were displayed the first time the application was opened

  • Do you want to reset preferences?

General Information

  • Jellow is a communicator using icons to enable speech and can be used by those learning to speak or those who have difficulty with speech.

  • It is developed at IDC School of Design at the Indian Institute of Technology Bombay located in Mumbai.

  • A novel Visual Emotional Language Protocol or VELP was conceived and developed by the project investigators in order to enhance the language ability of Jellow. VELP represents the 6 expressive icons that form the core of the interface.

  • Using these core icons, the child can communicate their likes, dislikes, and needs with others.

  • Jellow is conceived as children-friendly with an easy-to-learn interface.

  • The application is optimized for Android tablets.

  • Jellow is currently available in English and Hindi.

 Software Version: 1.2.1

  • The current version of Jellow is 1.2.1. The application is under further development. Therefore, if you have any suggestions for us, please submit it under the feedback tab.

 Terms of Use

  • Jellow is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution Non-commercial Share Alike 4.0 International License.

  • Work on Jellow is attributed to the Indian Institute of Technology Bombay.

  • The content in this application comprising icons, layout, architecture, visual identity, translation, and the software codes can be shared and adopted but cannot be used for commercial purposes.

  • When the content is used, we request you to acknowledge Indian Institute of Technology Bombay.

  • Jellow is available for download at www.dsource.in/tool/jellow

  • If interested in further developing the code, please write to Professor Ravi Poovaiah at ravi@iitb.ac.in

 Credits:

  • Idea Conception, Project Investigation and Supervision:
    • Prof. Ravi Poovaiah and Dr. Ajanta Sen
  • Initial Concept Development :
    • Anchal Kumar, Samraat Sardesai, Peter Joseph, Antara Hazarika
  • Software Development:
    • Rahul Rupchand Jidge, Narayana Reddy, Ayaz Alam, Harshit Budhraja, Sumeet Agrawal, Roop Sahoo, Shruti Gupta, Aastha Joshi, Dhairya Dand, Pritam Pebam
  • Website Design:
    • Prof. Ravi Poovaiah, Yogesh Masaye, Sumedh Garud, Roop Sahoo
  • Icons and Visual Design:
    • Vinaya Tawde, Anisha Malhotra, Nikita Iyer, Ganesh Gajjela
  • Translation:
    • Sachin Sonawane, Dr. Sudha Srinivasan
  • Research, Vocabulary Development, and User Studies:
    • Dr. Sudha Srinivasan
  • Support:
    • E-kalpa project sponsored under NMEICT by MHRD, Microsoft Design Expo 2004 and a 1-year seed grant through the UNICEF Innovation Fund

Jellow is a communicator using icons to enable speech and can be used by those learning to speak or those who have difficulty with speech. It is developed at IDC School of Design at the Indian Institute of Technology Bombay located in Mumbai. A novel Visual Emotional Language Proto call or VELP was conceived and developed by the project investigators in order to enhance the language ability of Jellow. VELP represents the 6 expressive icons that form the core of the interface. Using these core icons, the child can communicate their likes, dislikes, and needs with others. Jellow is conceived as children-friendly with an easy-to-learn interface. The application is optimized for Android tablets.Jellow is currently available in English and Hindi. The current version of Jellow is 1 point 2 point 1. The application is under further development. Therefore, if you have any suggestions for us, please submit it under the feedback tab. Jellow is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution Non-commercial Share Alike 4.0 International License. Work on Jellow is attributed to the Indian Institute of Technology Bombay. The content in this application comprising icons, layout, architecture, visual identity, translation, and the software codes can be shared and adopted but cannot be used for commercial purposes. When the content is used, we request you to acknowledge Indian Institute of Technology Bombay. Jellow is available for download at www dot d source.in/tool/jellow. If interested in further developing the code, please write to Professor Ravi Poovaiah at ravi @ i i t b dot a c.in
Jellow has 9 central category buttons and 6 expressive side buttons:
To speak using Jellow, the user first clicks on any category button and then on an expressive button in that order. For instance, Jellow will say, “I want to eat” using the selection below:
By double-clicking on a category button, the user can access further sub-categories:
The user can customize their profile and adjust the basic voice settings of the application by clicking on the top right corner of the screen:
Jellow can also be used to teach children sequential steps of daily activities. By clicking on any individual step, the user may view the expressive buttons:

To use Jellow, please activate \'Google text-to-speech (TTS)\' within \'Language\' settings of your device. Within Google TTS settings, first change the default language to preferred language and then download voice for preferred language through the \'Install voice data\' option
Press here to speak above text.
Jellow remembers the user’s “most-used/preferred” icons and displays them as the top choices on the screen
By resetting preferences, the icons will be set to the original order in which they were displayed the first time the application was opened
Do you want to reset preferences?
Please ensure an active Internet connection during the entire download process. In case the progress bar is stalled, kindly restart the app or try again
Kindly rate Jellow in all fields.
The application also has 6 expressive side buttons
The user first clicks on a category button and then on an expressive button
By double-clicking on a category button, user can access further categories and sub-categories
User can customize application settings by clicking on top right corner of the application
Now you are ready to get started with Jellow
(To be used for correspondence in case of an emergency involving the child)
(To notify you about the release of Jellow updates)
Step 2: Check if voice data for _ is available on your device. If not please download voice data for selected language.
Step 3: Set \'Google Text-to-speech (TTS)\' as default TTS engine and set _ as default language of the engine.
Step 4: Click \'Apply changes\' to set new language as default
You can follow the steps listed below to set a newly added language as the default for Jellow
Please complete Text-to-Speech engine setup given in this page
Selected language is already default language
Please check the \'Language\' settings of the app
Devices with active Google TTS engine: Please swipe to skip current step
Voice data is unavailable. Please turn on the Internet to download voice data.
Call permission is not available. Call permission is required to make a call in case of an emergency.
There are no board to delete
Are you sure you want to exit board ? \n Your selection will be lost.
Are you sure you want to exit ?
